CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) as it does not implement any CSRF tokens or similar security measures. This could allow an attacker to trick a victim into executing unwanted actions on a web application in which they're authenticated. Additionally, the function does not validate or sanitize the input data before processing it, making it vulnerable to attacks such as Cross-site Scripting (XSS), where an attacker could inject malicious scripts into the web page.
